description: A collection of circles in a formation shaped like an upside-down capital-Y intersected towards the top by a tilde (~) shape; another small upside-down capital-Y shaped formation extends from between the fork of the larger one. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a light brown triangle where the large Y-shaped formation is intersected by the tilde-shaped one and another small light brown triangle below that.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.

user.name: VertexArchive
